## Container.isNotEmpty() method

Checks if value is not empty. A value is considered empty unless itâ€™s an arguments object, array, string, or jQuery-like collection with a length greater than 0 or an object with own enumerable properties.

Signature:

```typescript
isNotEmpty(key: string): boolean;
```

Decorators:

`@bind`

## Parameters

| Parameter | Type   | Description |
| --------- | ------ | ----------- |
| key       | string | search key  |

Returns:

boolean

True if object is not empty.

## Example

```js
container.isNotEmpty("my-key");
// True if object associated with 'my-key' is not empty.
```
